review: Where do I start. We are Amazon Prime members and only use Amazon services. We returned the Roku and stopped using Apple TV. Everything positive said about this product is true. Fast, great video, great sound, easy interface and best of all voice command. The voice command never fails.Worth twice the price.
author: Rimfire

review: Super easy to use and operate! I want to give 5 stars but I continue to have two major issues.  One (the biggest) netflix won't play the selected item. It connects and processes fine for about 3 seconds - then an error appears to try again later; pick a different show. Two - SOUND! The sound blanks out in every show regardless of source, every 5 seconds (I timed it). UGH!  I looked for an update and couldn't find anything. I thought this problem had been fixed.  Does anyone have any ideas?
author: kmct

review: This is my first experience with this type of unit and I must say I'm amazed. I set it up on my samsung tv and it was easy to set up and it works fine with the provided remote.
author: luke lange

review: I've used a Roku for several years, and what bugs me most is the occasional reloading that seems to plague Roku.  I've often turned it off in frustration because I can't make sense of a program that reloads every minute.  Amazon Fire has a good strong connection and remains connected even in an area that doesn't have the best Internet connection.  I found the voice search capability fascinating.  It works well, and gives what you ask for.
author: wtcdean

review: The product has similar features to earlier smart tvs and BlueRays but does most of them using voice commands which have been very accurate. My only suggestion is to add an off switch as my old brain does not trust the unit to time out after I shut off the tv.
